KH.content: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens
KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: chaos, khaos, khaine, signifies the yawning, a split in two, close connection to aletheia, abyss which opens

BL.content: from title to incipit [re: Vor dem Gesetz], 2 moments, repetition, the same > dividing of letter, “it [the repetition itself] splits the boundary by dividing its line”
BL.linkedContent: from title to incipit [re: Vor dem Gesetz], 2 moments, repetition, the same > dividing of letter, “it [the repetition itself] splits the boundary by dividing its line”

LOBL.content: pose question of bord, bord de mer, question of borderline preceding the determination of all dividing lines I just mentioned [i.e. the general bord before the contextual one?]
LOBL.linkedContent: pose question of bord, bord de mer, question of borderline preceding the determination of all dividing lines I just mentioned [i.e. the general bord before the contextual one?]

DS.content: pirouette at one point—at “philosophical point,” at stigmē, here—already at another point (unties/divides along same line)
DS.linkedContent: pirouette at one point—at “philosophical point,” at stigmē, here—already at another point (unties/divides along same line)

P.content: two limits of edge: 1) internal, btwn frame & painting 2) external, separating from wall
P.linkedContent: two limits of edge: 1) internal, btwn frame & painting 2) external, separating from wall

P.content: effects of deconstructed frame would not be an absence of one, l’abîme [undo the frame] en coin dans ses angles et ses articulations, slyly—see picture from the side of the wood (not teleological, not harmony, internal becomes external); thickness taken into account
P.linkedContent: effects of deconstructed frame would not be an absence of one, l’abîme [undo the frame] en coin dans ses angles et ses articulations, slyly—see picture from the side of the wood (not teleological, not harmony, internal becomes external); thickness taken into account

P.content: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime
P.linkedContent: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime

OTO.content: borderline btwn “work” & “life”: dynamis, virtual & mobile potency, neither active nor passive, outside nor inside, not a thin line, traverses 2 bodies (corpus & body) > not an indivisible trait lying btwn enclosure of philosophemes & life of author identifiable behind name
OTO.linkedContent: borderline btwn “work” & “life”: dynamis, virtual & mobile potency, neither active nor passive, outside nor inside, not a thin line, traverses 2 bodies (corpus & body) > not an indivisible trait lying btwn enclosure of philosophemes & life of author identifiable behind name

OTO.content: problems of borderline occur whenever one seeks determination: dating event, identify beginning of text, the origin of life, first movement of a signature
OTO.linkedContent: problems of borderline occur whenever one seeks determination: dating event, identify beginning of text, the origin of life, first movement of a signature

ATIA.content: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”
ATIA.linkedContent: discussion is interesting [re: animals] once limit is abyssal (rather than limit as discontinuity): once frontier is not a single, indivisible line, but more than one internally divided lines (folds, foliations): “what are the edges of a limit that feed on an abyss?”

DIF.content: differance constitutes present in interval, constitutes present by dividing it > everything thus thought on basis of the present, in our metaphysical language, would also be divided (subject, substance, being, etc.)
DIF.linkedContent: differance constitutes present in interval, constitutes present by dividing it > everything thus thought on basis of the present, in our metaphysical language, would also be divided (subject, substance, being, etc.)

DPi.content: [vis-à-vis Hugo] border line of right to literature divides a good & bad Christianity
DPi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Hugo] border line of right to literature divides a good & bad Christianity

REST.content: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal
REST.linkedContent: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal

EJQB.content: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue
EJQB.linkedContent: poet or Jew: protects the desert that protects his speech (can speak only in desert), his writing (traced [sillonner] only in desert) > invents unfindable/unspecifiable pathway (un chemin introuvable et inassigné) > dont aucune résolution cartésienne ne peut nous assurer la droite ligne et l’issue

D.content: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)
D.linkedContent: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)

D.content: numerical multiplicity not death threat sneaking up on unified germ, it pathbreaks (fraye la voie) for “the” seed (semence), which advances/produces (itself) in plural: singular plural
D.linkedContent: numerical multiplicity not death threat sneaking up on unified germ, it pathbreaks (fraye la voie) for “the” seed (semence), which advances/produces (itself) in plural: singular plural

D.content: dissemination, germination, no first insemination, “primal” insemination is dissemination: a trace, graft, whose traces have been lost
D.linkedContent: dissemination, germination, no first insemination, “primal” insemination is dissemination: a trace, graft, whose traces have been lost

D.content: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]
D.linkedContent: each germ is its own term—finds its term w/in itself as its own internal limit, faisant angle avec sa proper mort [tracing, grafting, semen already swarming (essaimée)]

PPT.content: trait is never common, never even one, w/ & w/out itself, its divisibility founds texts, traces, remains
PPT.linkedContent: trait is never common, never even one, w/ & w/out itself, its divisibility founds texts, traces, remains

PPT.content: in [classical] discourses on painting, trait always determined as opposition-slash > what happens before difference becomes opposition? becoming always been a concept of determinate opposition
PPT.linkedContent: in [classical] discourses on painting, trait always determined as opposition-slash > what happens before difference becomes opposition? becoming always been a concept of determinate opposition

+R.content: rigor/joyous severity of trait, petrifying (médusante) impassivity of line > disjunction works on any equality, unhinges, interrupts, truncates > “integrity in dispersion”
+R.linkedContent: rigor/joyous severity of trait, petrifying (médusante) impassivity of line > disjunction works on any equality, unhinges, interrupts, truncates > “integrity in dispersion”

LI.content: dehiscence, botanical, divided opening, makes plant grow > law of undecidable contamination (like iterability)
LI.linkedContent: dehiscence, botanical, divided opening, makes plant grow > law of undecidable contamination (like iterability)

LI.content: what is re-markable about the mark includes margin w/in mark > mark is remarkable in that it “is” also its margin
LI.linkedContent: what is re-markable about the mark includes margin w/in mark > mark is remarkable in that it “is” also its margin

LI.content: line of margin can never be determined rigorously: divides the dividing-line & its unity at once > iterability allows for “negative” double, lie, also conditions so-called “positive” values
LI.linkedContent: line of margin can never be determined rigorously: divides the dividing-line & its unity at once > iterability allows for “negative” double, lie, also conditions so-called “positive” values

LI.content: iterability displaces dividing-line btwn opposition nature/convention

AD.content: very thrust (poussée) of Levinas’ thought: makes borderline (ligne de frontière), semantic identity of all the words he uses, tremble
AD.linkedContent: very thrust (poussée) of Levinas’ thought: makes borderline (ligne de frontière), semantic identity of all the words he uses, tremble

LG.content: law of impurity, contamination in heart of law, condition for possibility of law, the a priori of a counter-law: a line or trait, internal division, impurity, corruption, etc.
LG.linkedContent: law of impurity, contamination in heart of law, condition for possibility of law, the a priori of a counter-law: a line or trait, internal division, impurity, corruption, etc.

LG.content: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole
LG.linkedContent: trait that marks membership (l’appartenance) divides > boundary (bordure) of set comes to form by invagination—an internal pocket larger than the whole

LG.content: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)
LG.linkedContent: consequences of this division & overflowing (débordement) as singular as they are limitless (qu’illimitables)

LG.content: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]
LG.linkedContent: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]

UWC.content: sovereign mastery of interior > [indivisible] border of inside/outside vs. divisible limit, because divisible, it has a history > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the perhaps
UWC.linkedContent: sovereign mastery of interior > [indivisible] border of inside/outside vs. divisible limit, because divisible, it has a history > the divisible limit is the limit of the impossible, the perhaps
